definition: to dismiss military hierarchy using wine cups/cf Song founding Emperor Song Taizu 宋太祖 holds a banquet in 961 and persuades his senior army commanders to go home to their provinces

sentences.english: The General had promised to cede power by January.
sentences.chinese: 将军允诺于一月份之前交出兵权。

sentences.english: She had both military and imperial powers.
sentences.chinese: 她集兵权和王权于一身。

sentences.english: Once the military authority has been granted, it should not easily transfered.
sentences.chinese: 兵权一经授予，就不能马上收回。

definition: (of a warlord etc) to assemble one's personal army, thereby presenting a challenge to the central government
to be in a position of power
to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
to plot a rebellion/to conspire against the state
Tang and Song dynasty provincial governor, in Tang times having military and civil authority, but only civil authority in Song
lit. fence town/buffer region (between enemies)/Tang dynasty system of provincial administration under a provincial governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3]
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
